poem:
Title: "Ballad for Jeremy Cameron"

In Manchester's morning mist,
Young hearts, he'd gently insist,
Stood at life's serving line,
Bold as a ball on baseline.

"A Cross-continental tread,
Vegetarian, Socialist," headlines read,
In Grenada's dusk, his lights dim,
His life - a tennis hymn.

Returned serves, more than thrown,
Till the day the Ball Boy was called home.
Jeremy, you left, but your game plays on,
In every dawn and each new sun.
